snippet: The New York attorney general is investigating whether private equity firms converted fees into investments to reduce their tax bills, raising pressure on an industry bruised by the campaign season.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman is investigating whether some of the nation's biggest private equity firms, including Bain Capital, have abused a tax strategy in order to slice hundreds of millions of dollars from their tax bills; the investigation will intensify scrutiny of an industry that has already been bruised by the political campaign season.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE, JULIE CRESWELL and DAVID KOCIENIEWSKI

lead_paragraph: The New York attorney general is investigating whether private equity firms converted fees into investments to reduce their tax bills, raising pressure on an industry bruised by the campaign season.

headline.seo: Financial Firms Face Subpoenas on Tax Strategy
headline.main: Inquiry on Tax Strategy Adds to Scrutiny of Finance Firms
